summary:
Working either independently or via a number of training institutes, I have been delivering courses in English language and communication skills since 2001. Based in the Netherlands since 2004, I have specialised in the teaching of professionals who require English for their work and have successfully taught at many of the country’s biggest companies and institutions. Starting always from a participant’s individual aims, I design and teach courses which seek to provide the practical skills needed for better performance.

My half-English half-Dutch background, as well as my experiences living and working in different countries, inform my work on cross-cultural communication. Focusing specifically on how the English language is used in international settings, I help clients to communicate both appropriately and effectively in professional contexts. I don’t necessarily advocate a particular model – it’s far from clear that the world needs more ‘English’ people – but  encourage participants to place their existing communication practices within a broader international framework. Having outlined this framework, I look to equip them with the skills needed to tailor their language use in ways that make them more effective. 

My teaching is informed by my experience, but also my academic background. I have a PhD. from the University of Leiden, post-graduate qualifications in applied linguistics and pedagogy and master’s degrees from institutions in both the U.K. and the Netherlands.

If you are interested in either one-to-one Professional English Training or organising a group training on Cultural awareness and language use please feel free to contact me at the email address in my contact details above.
